title: Weapon Qualities: Import and Parse CSV Data
description:
MANUAL INTEGRATION PLAN: Weapon Qualities CSV → System Integration

## Overview
Integrate 72 weapon qualities from resources/weapon_qualities.csv into the system. This is NOT an automated import - each quality needs manual review, CONFIG definition, and mechanical implementation.

## Phase 1: Audit and Categorize (Manual)
Review CSV and categorize qualities by implementation complexity:

**Category A - Display Only (No Mechanics):**
- SM Wep, Integrated Weapon, Ogryn-Proof, Sanctified, Tainted, Daemon Wep, Rune Wep
- These just need CONFIG entries for tooltips/display

**Category B - Simple Stat Modifiers:**
- Accurate (+10 when aiming), Inaccurate (no aim bonus), Balanced (+10 parry), Defensive (+15 parry)
- Fast (-20 to parry against), Unbalanced (-10 to parry), Unwieldy (cannot parry)
- Apply as passive modifiers in roll calculations

**Category C - Damage Roll Modifications:**
- Tearing (roll extra d10, drop lowest), Proven(X) (min roll = X), Primitive(X) (max roll = X)
- Felling(X) (reduce Unnatural Toughness), Melta (2x pen at short range)
- Require D100Roll/damage formula integration

**Category D - Complex Conditional Effects:**
- Blast(X), Flame, Shocking, Toxic(X), Corrosive, Haywire(X), Smoke(X), Snare(X)
- Multiple targets, area effects, status conditions
- Require dialog prompts and active effect integration

**Category E - Advanced Roll Mechanics:**
- Overheats, Reliable, Unreliable (jam mechanics)
- Righteous Fury modifiers: Gauss (9-10), Vengeful(X)
- Scatter (range-dependent hit/damage), Storm (double RoF), Twin-Linked (+20 hit, 2x ammo)
- Deep integration with attack/damage flow

**Category F - Exotic/Unique:**
- Force (psyker bonus), Warp Weapon (ignore armour), Power Field (75% destroy weapon)
- Lance (pen scaling), Living Ammunition, Witch-Edge, Daemonbane
- May need special case handlers

## Phase 2: Update CONFIG.weaponQualities (Manual)
For each quality, add entry to config.mjs:

```javascript
ROGUE_TRADER.weaponQualities = {
    'tearing': {
        label: 'RT.WeaponQuality.Tearing',
        description: 'RT.WeaponQuality.TearingDesc',
        hasLevel: false,
        category: 'damage-mod', // For organization
        mechanicalEffect: true,  // Flags that it affects rolls
    },
    'blast': {
        label: 'RT.WeaponQuality.Blast',
        description: 'RT.WeaponQuality.BlastDesc',
        hasLevel: true, // Blast(X)
        category: 'area-effect',
        mechanicalEffect: true,
    },
    // ... 70+ more
};
```

Add localization keys to lang/en.json with CSV descriptions.

## Phase 3: Update Weapon Pack Data (Manual, Quality by Quality)
For EACH quality in CSV:
1. Find all weapons in pack with that quality (grep special array)
2. Verify quality identifier matches CONFIG key
3. Check if level needed (e.g., blast-3, toxic-2)
4. Validate mechanical correctness against CSV rules
5. Update any mismatched identifiers

Example script pattern:
```bash
# Find all weapons with 'tearing' quality
grep -r '"tearing"' src/packs/rt-items-weapons/_source/

# Check for variants (Tearing, TEARING, etc.)
grep -ri 'tearing' src/packs/rt-items-weapons/_source/
```

## Phase 4: Implement Mechanical Effects (Code, Per Category)
Implement in order of complexity:

### 4A: Display-Only Qualities
- Already done (getQualityDefinition in CONFIG)
- Just add tooltip display

### 4B: Simple Modifiers (Balanced, Accurate, etc.)
- Extend WeaponData.effectiveToHit getter
- Add quality-based modifiers in attack roll calculation

### 4C: Damage Modifications (Tearing, Proven, Felling)
- Extend damage roll formula generation
- Add quality handlers in D100Roll or damage calculation

### 4D: Complex Effects (Blast, Flame, Toxic)
- Create quality effect handlers
- Dialog prompts for AoE targeting
- Active effect application for conditions

### 4E: Advanced Mechanics (Storm, Lance, Overcharge)
- Deep integration with attack flow
- RoF modifications, ammo consumption changes
- Penetration scaling logic

### 4F: Exotic (Force, Warp, Power Field)
- Special case handlers
- May need item type checks (psyker weapons)
- Parry destruction mechanics

## Phase 5: Testing (Manual, Per Quality)
For each implemented quality:
- [ ] Test with weapon from pack
- [ ] Test with user-created weapon
- [ ] Verify tooltip displays correctly
- [ ] Verify mechanical effect applies
- [ ] Test edge cases (multiple qualities, stacking, etc.)

## Dependencies
- RogueTraderVTT-9rl: Must be broken into sub-tasks per category
- RogueTraderVTT-b7j: Righteous Fury (affects Gauss, Vengeful)
- RogueTraderVTT-b8j: RoF system (affects Storm, Twin-Linked)
- RogueTraderVTT-zlo: Range brackets (affects Scatter, Melta)
- RogueTraderVTT-61x: Critical damage (affected by many qualities)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 72 qualities in CONFIG.weaponQualities
- [ ] All quality identifiers in pack data match CONFIG keys
- [ ] All qualities with hasLevel properly formatted (e.g., 'blast-3')
- [ ] Category A-B qualities fully functional (display + simple modifiers)
- [ ] Category C-F have tickets and implementation plans
- [ ] Documentation of which qualities are implemented vs placeholder
- [ ] Test suite covering quality application

## Estimated Timeline
- Phase 1 (Audit): 4-6 hours
- Phase 2 (CONFIG): 3-4 hours  
- Phase 3 (Pack data): 8-12 hours (1174 weapons!)
- Phase 4 (Mechanics): 40-60 hours (depends on category)
- Phase 5 (Testing): 10-15 hours

Total: ~65-100 hours of work

## Priority
P1 (High) - This is foundational for weapon system functionality. Many combat mechanics depend on qualities working correctly.

title: Implement weapon parsing for stat blocks
description:
Parse weapon stat lines from stat block text.

## Weapon Formats
### Melee
```
Claws (1d10+10 R, Pen 1; Razor Sharp, Tearing)
shock maul (1d10+3 I; Shocking)
```

### Ranged
```
Combat shotgun (30m; S/3/–; 1d10+4 I; Pen 0; Clip 18; Reload Full; Scatter)
hand cannon (35m; S/–/–; 1d10+4 I; Pen 2; Clip 5; Reload 2 Full)
```

## Parsing Rules
1. **Name**: Text before first parenthesis
2. **Range**: Number followed by 'm' (melee weapons have no range)
3. **Rate of Fire**: Pattern like S/3/– or S/–/– (Single/Semi/Full)
4. **Damage**: Pattern like 1d10+4 I or 2d10 R
5. **Penetration**: 'Pen X' or 'Pen 0'
6. **Clip**: 'Clip X' for ammo capacity
7. **Reload**: 'Reload X' (Half, Full, 2 Full, etc.)
8. **Qualities**: Remaining items (Scatter, Tearing, Razor Sharp, Shocking)

## Output
```javascript
{
  weapons: [
    {
      name: 'Claws',
      class: 'melee',
      damage: '1d10+10',
      damageType: 'R',
      penetration: 1,
      qualities: ['Razor Sharp', 'Tearing']
    },
    {
      name: 'Combat shotgun',
      class: 'basic',  // inferred from range/type
      range: 30,
      rateOfFire: { single: true, semi: 3, full: false },
      damage: '1d10+4',
      damageType: 'I',
      penetration: 0,
      clip: 18,
      reload: 'Full',
      qualities: ['Scatter']
    }
  ]
}
```

## Edge Cases
- Damage types: R (Rending), I (Impact), E (Energy), X (Explosive)
- Missing penetration defaults to 0
- '–' in RoF means not available
- Parenthetical notes in qualities: '(or 3 w/Man-Stopper Rounds)'

title: Weapon Qualities: Implement Mechanical Effects
description:
Implement mechanical effects for weapon qualities in roll/damage logic. This is a LARGE EPIC that depends on RogueTraderVTT-4vg completing Phase 1-3 (CONFIG setup + pack validation).

## Architecture Overview
Create quality effect handler system that hooks into:
1. Attack Roll Flow (D100Roll / RogueTraderActor.rollItem)
2. Damage Roll Flow (damage calculation / damage application)
3. Combat Flow (area effects, multi-target, conditions)

## Implementation Pattern
```javascript
// In D100Roll or attack handler
class QualityEffectHandler {
    static applyToAttackRoll(weapon, rollData) {
        for (const quality of weapon.system.effectiveSpecial) {
            const handler = this.getHandler(quality);
            if (handler?.affectsAttack) {
                handler.modifyAttackRoll(rollData);
            }
        }
    }
    
    static applyToDamageRoll(weapon, damageData) {
        for (const quality of weapon.system.effectiveSpecial) {
            const handler = this.getHandler(quality);
            if (handler?.affectsDamage) {
                handler.modifyDamageRoll(damageData);
            }
        }
    }
}
```

## Sub-Tasks (Must be completed in order)

### CATEGORY A: Display-Only Qualities (Informational)
**Qualities:** SM Wep, Integrated Weapon, Ogryn-Proof, Sanctified, Tainted, Daemon Wep, Rune Wep

**Implementation:**
- Already handled by CONFIG tooltips
- No mechanical effects needed
- May add visual indicators on sheet

**Estimated Time:** 1-2 hours
**Priority:** P3 (low impact)

---

### CATEGORY B: Simple Stat Modifiers (Attack/Parry Bonuses)
**Qualities:** Accurate, Inaccurate, Balanced, Defensive, Fast, Unbalanced, Unwieldy

**Mechanical Effects:**
- Accurate: +10 to BS when using Aim action
- Inaccurate: Cannot use Aim action
- Balanced: +10 to WS for parry
- Defensive: +15 to parry
- Fast: Enemies suffer -20 to parry this weapon
- Unbalanced: -10 to parry attempts
- Unwieldy: Cannot parry with this weapon

**Implementation:**
- Extend WeaponData.effectiveToHit getter to check for qualities
- Add quality checks in parry logic
- Hook into combat action system (Aim action)

**Estimated Time:** 4-6 hours
**Priority:** P2 (common qualities, moderate impact)
**Depends On:** Combat action system basics

---

### CATEGORY C: Damage Roll Modifications
**Qualities:** Tearing, Proven(X), Primitive(X), Felling(X), Melta, Power Field

**Mechanical Effects:**
- Tearing: Roll additional d10 for damage, drop lowest die
- Proven(X): Damage rolls below X count as X (min damage)
- Primitive(X): Damage rolls above X count as X (max damage, except RF)
- Felling(X): Reduce Unnatural Toughness by X when calculating damage reduction
- Melta: Double penetration at short range
- Power Field: Increase damage/pen (in stats), 75% destroy enemy weapon on parry

**Implementation:**
- Extend damage formula generation in WeaponData
- Add quality handlers in damage roll evaluation

title: Weapon Comparison Dialog - Side-by-side weapon stat comparison
notes:
## Weapon Comparison Dialog

### Overview
Create a comparison dialog that allows players to compare two weapons side-by-side to make informed purchase/equipment decisions.

### User Stories
1. As a player, I want to compare my current weapon with a potential upgrade
2. As a GM, I want to quickly compare NPC weapons for balance
3. As a player, I want to see the effective difference when considering modifications

### Design

#### Launch Methods
1. **From weapon sheet**: 'Compare' button opens dialog with current weapon pre-selected
2. **From inventory**: Multi-select weapons -> 'Compare' action
3. **From compendium**: Right-click -> 'Compare with...'

#### Dialog Layout
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ Weapon Comparison                               [Close] │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ ┌─────────────────────┐  ┌─────────────────────┐       │
│ │ [Drop Zone A]       │  │ [Drop Zone B]       │       │
│ │ or Select Weapon ▼  │  │ or Select Weapon ▼  │       │
│ └─────────────────────┘  └─────────────────────┘       │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                    COMPARISON TABLE                     │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Stat          │  Weapon A     │  Weapon B     │ Diff   │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Damage        │  1d10+3       │  1d10+5       │ +2 ▲   │
│ Penetration   │  4            │  6            │ +2 ▲   │
│ Range         │  30m          │  40m          │ +10m ▲ │
│ RoF           │  S/-/6        │  S/3/6        │ Semi ▲ │
│ Clip          │  30           │  24           │ -6 ▼   │
│ Reload        │  Full         │  Half         │ ▲      │
│ Weight        │  4kg          │  5kg          │ +1kg ▼ │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Qualities A: Reliable, Accurate                        │
│ Qualities B: Tearing, Proven (3)                       │
│ ────────────────────────────────────────────────────── │
│ Only in A: Reliable, Accurate                          │
│ Only in B: Tearing, Proven (3)                         │
│ Both: None                                             │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ [Swap Weapons]  [Clear]                   [Close]      │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

#### Comparison Logic
```javascript
compareWeapons(weaponA, weaponB) {
    return {
        damage: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectiveDamageLabel,
            b: weaponB.system.effectiveDamageLabel,
            diff: this._compareDamage(weaponA, weaponB)
        },
        penetration: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectivePenetration,
            b: weaponB.system.effectivePenetration,
            diff: weaponB.system.effectivePenetration - weaponA.system.effectivePenetration,
            better: 'higher'
        },
        range: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectiveRange,
            b: weaponB.system.effectiveRange,
            diff: weaponB.system.effectiveRange - weaponA.system.effectiveRange,
            better: 'higher'
        },
        // etc...
        
        qualities: {
            a: weaponA.system.effectiveSpecial,
            b: weaponB.system.effectiveSpecial,
            onlyA: setDifference(a, b),
            onlyB: setDifference(b, a),
            both: setIntersection(a, b)
        }
    };
}
```

#### Visual Indicators
- **Green arrow up (▲)**: B is better
- **Red arrow down (▼)**: A is better  
- **Gray dash (─)**: Same value
- **Yellow (~)**: Trade-off (e.g., damage dice differ)

title: Implement characteristic parsing for stat blocks
description:
Implement parsing logic for characteristics in both stat block formats.

## Format 1: Traditional Horizontal Table
```
WS BS S T Ag Int Per WP Fel
(10) (10) (10)
43 — 59 53 47 16 54 23 04
```
- Header row defines order
- Second row has unnatural modifiers in parentheses (aligned to columns)
- Third row has base values
- '—' indicates no value (typically BS for beasts)

## Format 2: Vertical List
```
Weapon Skill	38
Ballistic Skill	38
Strength	38
...
```
- Each characteristic on own line
- Full name followed by tab/spaces and value
- No unnatural modifiers in this format (check Traits for Unnatural X)

## Output
```javascript
{
  characteristics: {
    weaponSkill: { base: 43 },
    ballisticSkill: { base: 0 },  // for '—'
    strength: { base: 59 },
    // ...
  },
  unnaturalCharacteristics: {
    strength: 2,      // from (x2) or (10) 
    toughness: 2,
    perception: 2
  }
}
```

## Edge Cases
- Handle both abbreviated (WS, BS, S, T) and full names
- Handle '—', '-', or empty for no value
- Handle unnatural as (x2) or flat bonus (10)
- Handle leading zeros (04 -> 4)
